snippet: The death of Frank Mercado, 77, ruled a homicide by the medical examiner, highlights the hazards of nursing homes in New York, where rates of substandard care and abuse are high, according to studies.
abstract: Cherrylee Young, veteran employee of University Nursing Home in Bronx, is charged with negligent homicide in beating death of 77-year-old dementia patient Frank Mercado; death, in facility with an exemplary health care history, reveals vulnerability of frail and dependent nursing home residents in New York State, which national studies reveal has high rates of substandard care, neglect and abuse.

byline.original: By TATIANA SCHLOSSBERG and NINA BERNSTEIN

lead_paragraph: The death of Frank Mercado, 77, ruled a homicide by the medical examiner, highlights the hazards of nursing homes in New York, where rates of substandard care and abuse are high, according to studies.

headline.main: Death in Bronx Shows Vulnerability of State’s Nursing Home Residents
headline.print_headline: Death in Bronx Shows Vulnerability of State’s Nursing Home Residents
